title: How to Use Your Canon TS3150 Printer Wirelessly

steps.title: Turn on your printer.
steps.content: Turn on your printer. The light next to the power button should be illuminated if it is on. You'll find this power button on the front display of your printer on the left side. [1] X Research source You won't need access to your router to complete this method. Instead, the printer will access the information needed from your smartphone or smart device that's connected to the Wi-Fi network. If this method does not work for you, try the next method.

steps.title: Get the Canon app from the Google Play Store or App Store.
steps.content: Get the Canon app from the Google Play Store or App Store. This app is free and is called Canon PRINT Inkjet/SELPHY, offered by Canon Inc. You can search for "Canon PRINT" in the search bar at the top of the Google Play Store or in the search tab that's located at the bottom of the App Store.

steps.title: Press and hold the Direct button on the printer.
steps.content: Press and hold the Direct button on the printer. This has the icon of a mobile phone on it and is usually the 2nd button below the power button. Release the button when the Direct icon flashes on the display screen.

steps.title: Open the Canon app on your phone or tablet.
steps.content: Open the Canon app on your phone or tablet. This app icon looks like a printer on an orange and white background that you'll find on one of your Home screens, in the app drawer, or by searching. When you open the app for the first time, it will notify you that no printers are connected and walk you through setting one up.

steps.title: Follow the on-screen prompts to set up your printer with your mobile app.
steps.content: Follow the on-screen prompts to set up your printer with your mobile app. This includes tapping your printer from the list of detected Canon printers, then allowing the printer to connect via your Wi-Fi router. If you have a Wi-Fi password enabled, you'll need to enter it before continuing.

steps.title: Follow the on-screen prompts to register your printer.
steps.content: Follow the on-screen prompts to register your printer. When you're done following the on-screen prompts, the Wi-Fi light (Network icon) should be solid on the display screen. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Go to the Canon Start Up page.
steps.content: Go to the Canon Start Up page . You can use any web browser to complete the setup process for your printer and computer.

steps.title: Click Set Up.
steps.content: Click Set Up . You'll see this next to a red unboxing icon in the middle of the web page.

steps.title: Enter TS3150 and click Go.
steps.content: Enter TS3150 and click Go . Capitalization does not matter. If a region or country selection screen appears, follow the on-screen instructions to continue.

steps.title: Click Download.
steps.content: Click Download . If you're using Windows 10 in S mode, this method will not work; the necessary drivers and software (Inkjet Print Utility) you'll need will automatically download to your computer when your printer is connected to the network. [3] X Research source Your OS should be detected automatically and you should see the appropriate downloads; however, you can change the OS in the drop-down menu that's located in the upper right corner of the page.

steps.title: Click the .exe (Windows) or .dmg (Mac) file.
steps.content: Click the .exe (Windows) or .dmg (Mac) file. If you're using Windows, you might have to give the file permission to continue. On a Mac, click Next .

steps.title: Click Start Setup.
steps.content: Click Start Setup . You'll see this at the top of the new window.

steps.title: Click to select your region and country.
steps.content: Click to select your region and country. The countries listed change as you select different regions, so if you don't see your country listed in one region, try another. Click Next to continue.

steps.title: Click Yes after you read the license agreement.
steps.content: Click Yes after you read the license agreement. Make sure you agree to the terms before clicking Yes to continue.

steps.title: Click Agree or Do not agree to install survey software.
steps.content: Click Agree or Do not agree to install survey software. It doesn't matter if you agree to this additional software; you'll be able to use the printer either way.

steps.title: Make sure the box is checked next to "Deactivate the block.
steps.content: Make sure the box is checked next to "Deactivate the block. " This ensures that your printer and computer can communicate through the firewall. Click Next to continue.

steps.title: Select the connection type (if the connection selection screen appears).
steps.content: Select the connection type (if the connection selection screen appears). You can choose to use a wireless connection or USB connection. [4] X Research source If your computer automatically detected the connection to your printer and didn't display this screen, you can skip this step.

steps.title: Click Yes (if you see the check connection method screen).
steps.content: Click Yes (if you see the check connection method screen). You should see your printer's serial number displayed as well as any other pertinent information, like your wireless router's ID. If the information displayed on this screen is incorrect, click No to be able to reconnect to a different router or printer.

steps.title: Click Next.
steps.content: Click Next . You'll see this after you've successfully connected your printer and computer. To complete the setup, continue following the on-screen instructions, including aligning the print head and performing a print test.

steps.title: Click Next to install the appropriate software.
steps.content: Click Next to install the appropriate software. You'll be able to select parts of the software (like the Quick Menu) to install.

steps.title: Click Exit.
steps.content: Click Exit . When the printing software is downloaded and installed, you'll be able to close the setup tutorial. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Turn on your printer.
steps.content: Turn on your printer. The light next to the power button should be illuminated if it is on. [6] X Research source You'll find this power button on the front display of your printer on the left side. You'll need access to your router to complete this method.

steps.title: Press and hold the Network button.
steps.content: Press and hold the Network button. This has the icon of a signal tower on it and it is usually the button below the power button. Release the button when the network icon flashes in the larger display panel.

steps.title: Press and hold the WPS button on the router.
steps.content: Press and hold the WPS button on the router. This usually looks like a small blue circular button that varies in location depending on the router's manufacturer. If you need more information on finding the WPS button on your router, refer to the router's manual. When the secure connection is successful, you'll see a three-line signal icon next to the network icon in the display on the left side of the printer.
